interestingFact: The United States has the world's largest economy by nominal GDP.
China has the world's largest population and is home to the Great Wall, one of the New Seven Wonders of the World.
India is the world's largest democracy and is famous for its diverse culture and heritage.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, the largest rainforest in the world.
Germany is known for its engineering excellence and is the largest economy in Europe.
Tokyo, the capital of Japan, is the most populous metropolitan area in the world.
Russia is the largest country in the world by area, covering more than 17 million square kilometers.
The United Kingdom is home to the world's oldest parliamentary democracy.
France is the most visited country in the world, attracting millions of tourists each year.
Australia is the only country that is also a continent, and it has more kangaroos than people.
